intro: Pisonia rapaensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a waxy texture. Pisonia rapaensis thrives in coastal and humid environments, typically growing in shrubland or forest understories.
